website_summaries.verdict: As long as you're a patient snapshooter, the Kodak EasyShare Z950 is a respectable compact megazoom camera.
pros: Nice features, photo quality for the money

customer_reviews.title: Very Very good camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had many Kodak cameras, but this one is (by far) the best Kodak I've owned. My last 1 was a V1073, gave good pictures but was very hard to view outside. This one seems to be much better at that. Pictures are of the best type. Have not found anything about this camera that I can talk bad about. Price-great. pictures-great. If I had anything bad to say about it, that would have to be the owners manual (users guide). It isn't the best I've used, but I can work around that part of it. Believe me, this Z950 is well worth it's price and will give you all you are asking for.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley A. Guerin

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I needed an easy to use camera that takes sharp pictures and video. This camera fits the bill. With the 10X zoom, I took a picture of a lion at the zoo, and I can see his fur like I'm next to him. Video is just as clear. It is easy to upload the pictures to my computer using the supplied USB cord. The price was excellent, too for a camera with all those features.
customer_reviews.author: Obplayer

customer_reviews.title: kodak z950 camera
customer_reviews.text: this is the first Kodak digital camera I have purchased in about 9 years. I did not like the earlier digital models - too flimsy and cheap looking, plus, requiring 4 double A batteries (not a good thing at a sports venue juggling 8 batteries without dropping any). the Z950 has the heft and looks of a more expensive point and shoot, and the sports setting works great. this camera is a compliment to my other cameras, both nikons, and each has a purpose. Thank you, Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: kiwi

customer_reviews.title: John's Z950 Review
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not yet used many of the camera's features, the one's I have used were relatively easy to learn and they perform well. For some reason, a few of the pictures taken without flash did not automatically focus well. I have to admit that I really miss having an optical viewfinder as the LED viewfinder is sometimes hard to see in the sun and it is difficult to snap rapidly moving objects using the LED viewfinder. The quality of the in-focus pictures is excellent and they can be blown up a great deal without losing resolution. I am a little disappointed in the battery as in that it is quite small and doesn't last long between charges.
customer_reviews.author: John Edward Larson

customer_reviews.title: my camera
customer_reviews.text: i looked at cameras for a year before getting this one its really a good camera a mid ranged camera for a good price has a nice compromise between zoom capability's and size. I love the fact that you can get a picture of a bird or plane up closer then you can see it with your eye. it would be a good camera for someone like me who wants to take nice photos and do some birding and not spend a ton.
customer_reviews.author: Forestry Major

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Have not had the camera long enough to learn all the features, but I'm still well pleased. I used the Program setting for most pictures so far. Picture quality is great and the zoom is impressive. Shot my nephew and his friends at from over 100 yards and the picture was so clear there was no problem picking out who was who. At high MP's it does take a second or two to process, but I didn't buy the camera to take modeling pictures. When I finally learn to set the camera for different conditions I'm sure I'll be even happier. And you can't beat $117.
customer_reviews.author: Otis

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Reading other reviews I had a good idea of what to expect, Thanks other reviewers! I was told after 3 pictures taken fast that it would take time to process next picture, exactly right, but not a issue for me. So many capabilities in a small package with good software, and customer support make this a great buy. To the speeders: Use a class 4 or 6 memory card
customer_reviews.author: whatdidtrumpdonow

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, incredible value!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but I feel the need to for this camera. We were looking to find an affordable replacement for an older 3MP camera. This camera was just what we needed. It is the most user friendly and intuitive camera I have ever used. It takes great pictures and pretty good video for a digicam. I did alot of research before buying and for $109.95 I feel that I got a great deal. Don't pay more than you have to. This camera is as good as Canons and Panasonics that sell for $50-$120 more than what you'll pay for this one.
customer_reviews.author: THE TRUTH IS OUT THERE

customer_reviews.title: I was just waiting for low-cost point-&-shoot digital cameras to get faster sensors so that I could shoot at night.
customer_reviews.text: Metamora, Indiana was always an inspiring place to photograph. I was just waiting for low-cost point-&-shoot digital cameras to get faster sensors so that I could shoot at night. Last Spring, I bought a Refurbished Kodak Easyshare z950 for $115. It has an ISO speed of 3200 which is a big jump from my previous camera that had an ISO of 400. It does nice night photography.
customer_reviews.author: R. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Maria
customer_reviews.text: I had the EasyShare c875, and was very happy with it and decided to upgrade to the higher zoom of the Z950 after reading other customer reviews here on Amazon. I was pleased with the control for the zoom and the increased video quality. Also the seperate power button and rechargeable lithium ion battery. Definitely recommend for the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: momma maria

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a camera that was too complicated to operate. I read lots of camera reviews and kept coming back to the Z950. I also liked the sale price. I asked advice from some family members that knew more about cameras and they thought this would be perfect for me. It is easy to operate and I like using the zoom. My old camera is Kodak Easy Share CX7300. I am giving it to my daughter. She can learn on it like I did and then upgrade someday.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hays

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z950
customer_reviews.text: I believe this to be the best digital camera for the price. It is a very good point and shoot but can be set for aperture or shutter speed. The quality of the picture is outstanding. Even when zoomed in the image stabilization keeps the picture from blurring. The color quality is also excellent,the picture and the scene match perfectly. I bought one for my wife at Christmas and liked it so much I replaced my 18month old KodakZ875 with a new Z950. Kodak improved that much over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Benton

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z950 - Great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Before buying the Z950 I compared the picture quality to a few other cameras (some much more expensive). I found the Kodak to give the best picture quality for novices. Some other camera in the same class are geared more for serious photographers, who want something smaller than their SLR. The Kodak is geared toward the novice, who wants better pictures than a mini-camera can provide. The only drawback to this camera is that is is a little slow to turn on and there is a 2+ second pause between pictures. While that is annoying - the picture quality makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for its price
customer_reviews.text: This camera means the end of our long trip finding a good camera in this price range. We owned an older Kodak Z650, which was stolen from us. Then we tried a Fuji camera but soon turned back to Kodak with the z981. However, it was a complete nightmare!!! We than sold it quickly and fortunately did not left Kodak. A sales agent from Kodak recommended the z950, which is far better than the 981 (while it's much cheaper!!). The picture quality is excellent, the features are maximally satisfy our needs and it is very easy to use and travel with. I DO SUGGEST EVERYONE TO BUY THIS NICE CAMERA!
customer_reviews.author: gyimesimate

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera if you are not in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just about perfect for me. The only flaw is the time between photos. It is far slower than any of my other cameras. So it you are not snapping consecutive shots, this the camera for you. If you like quick repetitive photos then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Goodbyte

customer_reviews.title: Slick piece of equipment for under $150
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a camera aficionado, but I've always liked Kodak products and this one hasn't disappointed. It's got a slick aesthetic and takes the sort of crisp photos I'd expect for a camera just under the $150 mark. Slight longer lag between pictures than I'd like, but no complaints otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton T. Barzon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera that produce nice pictures when you set the right features for the right scenario.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very quick and when performance, quality and affordable price are required the Z950 does the job. Just think: HD pictures & videos, 12mp, 10x optical zoom, 3 inch screen, Kodak quality, etc all in one camera for a reasonable price. I highly recommend the Z950.
customer_reviews.author: M. Paris

customer_reviews.title: We owned a Kodak Easyshare DX7590 and happy about it
customer_reviews.text: We owned a Kodak Easyshare DX7590 and happy about it, 6 years later we've decided to get this Kodak Easyshare Z950 for me just to carry in my pocket or in my purse when i go somewhere or taking a walk with my kids and are glad we did, pictures are great so as the video, and the camera is sturdy. I've been using this Z 950 for 5 years now and the camera still works like new, we are hoping this camera will lasts for more years as we are happy with the kodak brand.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Roste

customer_reviews.title: Great small point and shoot camera!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easy to use camera that isn't too big and bulky. This camera is perfect. It takes very clear pictures, and I really like that it has a setting to take pictures of objects in motion. I also love that it has a rechargable battery--my friends spend a fortune on AA batteries for their cameras. I would definitely reccoment this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is worth the money, but could be better in consrtuction. The battery door is flimsy an comes open easily. The usb connection cover is attached by a little rubber tang and is difficult to open, you have to be careful not to pull it off the camera. The screen is hard to see in daylight, so forget about manual focus in bright light. The pictures I have taken so far are GREAT looking on the computer monitor or HDTV. I have a KODAK ESP 3250 printer and my prints are VERY GOOD. I love that it can record 2 SD video & 1 HD video resolutions. It is really worth the cost, despite it's problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kodak stands behind their cameras
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the Z950 for the price. LCD screen was defective, but Kodak repaired it under warranty. Seems OK so far. Pictures are on a par with the Z915. 12 megapixels gives a little more flexibility than 10. Only complaint is very slow to save to the SD card. The HD video is an improvement over the Z915.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Weibel

customer_reviews.title: Jimmy's Christmas camera
customer_reviews.text: I really don't have a great deal of experience yet with this camera, but so far so good. I really like the looks and feel of it. Picture quality seems to be good , but I have used the 10X zoom very little, so not much input on that. Likewise on taking videos. I like the 3" LCD screen and the ease of operation. It has the main features I was looking for: 3" screen, 10X zoom, Li-Ion battery, and still pretty much pocket size. Will probably review again after more use with it.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Tingle

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera...until it broke.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our z950 for the past year and a half. The High ISO feature made pictures indoors a breeze and we got many great pictures of our very active kids. Unfortunately it is a paperweight now because it will no longer accept the memory card (won't stay in). Too bad, we really enjoyed it until then.
customer_reviews.author: Gleason Family of 6

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Replacement for model that got dropped
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Replacement for model that got dropped. Happy to have it back!
customer_reviews.author: sandra billets

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I actually downgraded my camera to get this one because my more expensive fancy camera was too bulky. I wanted one that was more portable but still had the quality glass lense. This was it. I love it. Picture quality is great. Just as good as my other camera. To be fair, you should know that I only use Kodak cameras so that is the limit of my comparison.
customer_reviews.author: slwchew

customer_reviews.title: Kodak EasyShare
customer_reviews.text: I owned this camera previously and it became damaged. I truely enjoyed it and it was easy to use. I enjoyed it so much that when the one I had was damaged the only choice I could see was to buy another. I am very pleased with this product and would purchase it again if the need for another arose.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of two

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera at Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that was smaller than the one I already own and this one had all the features I was looking for...zoom, lots of megapixels, rechargable battery and easy to use and it's a Kodak! Great price and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy from Western New York

customer_reviews.title: My camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived in good condition, ready to operate after the battery was connected. The instruction manual was skimpy, leaving some questions unanswered. The camera itself works well. Since it is a 12 mp camera, the resulting images can be cropped and manipulated without significantly degrading the image. It would be nice if the camera had a viewfinder. I find it difficult to precisely frame a picture. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: NoPenName

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted and expected
customer_reviews.text: I already have a camera just like it which has been used often for at least 3 years. Since the camera is no longer being made, I wanted to replace mine with an identical one. The pictures are excellent and I know the camera; thus, I don't have to learn to operate a new one. CAC
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Cox

customer_reviews.title: Camera
customer_reviews.text: Though the camera is heavy,despite its size, I have been impressed with the pictures I have taken. I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Djean

customer_reviews.title: Great camera at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kodak 5 mega pixel Z740 which is a good camera, but the new Kodak Z950 is better in the respect that it is more of a point and shoot type with alot more features. Not as cumbersome to carry, with the same 10x optical zoom and 12 mega pixels, the rechargable battery is a plus. I like his camera very much. Great pictures at an affordable price. I would recomend is camera to anyone! Sincerely James Ely
customer_reviews.author: James W. Ely

customer_reviews.title: Very good, compact camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera for an amature photographer. Pictures were quite clear, and the 10X zoom works well, with very handy operational trigger. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur C. Schlicht

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a stolen Kodak that I thought I loved. Love this one even more. Takes super pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, takes great pictures, does not come with sd card, consider that when you are compairing price's, some sellers include the sd card! In hind sight I would have rather bought a Kodak package ie sd card, carrying pouch etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: My easy share
customer_reviews.text: Great picture and video for a point and shoot.If you can't be bothered with all the fancy settings you just want to take a picture with good quality this is your starter camera nice features good video but low sound playback through camera speaker.
customer_reviews.author: W.D

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Easyshare Z950
customer_reviews.text: There was no view finder available for those very bright sunny days. I found the camera was bulky and the plastic construction were no comparison to the Canon Power Shot I already own. The buttons next to the LCD added no value to me. The user manual is not user friendly and online extended manual was just as bad. I found myself calling Kodak to answer my questions. Good price from Amazon, but I would suggest paying more for a Canon product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Therese Curtin

customer_reviews.title: I get good pictures
customer_reviews.text: The camera is now a few years old. I set the camera on 'auto' and take snapshots, which is what this type of camera was designed to do, and I get good pictures. If you want pro quality portraits you need to buy a pro camera and lenses. The only problem I have is the USB stopped working. I bought an inexpensive SD card reader to avoid replacing the camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Color, quality at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: We take a LOT of photos. {6000 photos plus per year} If you're looking for a easy to use, well made, excellent zoom, with the BEST color quality of any camera out there in this price range, you won't find a better camera. We tried the others, {Cannon, Nikon, Minolta, etc.}, nothing comes close. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AMD

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: if you are looking for a simple to use camera that takes a great picture look no further. Love the zoom on it and the different modes video in 720 p seems to be ok. I picked this camera cause of Cnets positive reviews and it was the right price range.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for price!
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera for price! !10 x zoom is awesome...though no digital zoom. Found that to prevent picture blur must always use camera in sport mode to ensure high shutterspeed. Definitely would buy again. Color and picture quality fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Derrie Farm

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z950
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could post some of the pics I've captured with this camera. Just took it out of the box and started shooting. The color is amazing and closeup are really great. This is the first camera in years I've been really happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Lb

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge Kodak fan, but after purchasing a Kodak printer and now a camera...I've changed my tune. This camera is perfect if you just need a camera for those occasions that are on the move, like birthday parties, kid's playing @ the park, or a sports activity. The quality of picture is good, but I'm biased because my other camera is a Sony Alpha, so I have pretty high standards. Perfect to carry around in a purse or diaper bag for those times when you needed the "in case" camera. Rechargeable battery is great- saves a bundle on purchasing AA's.
customer_reviews.author: K. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera for the size, easy to use and the pictures are so crips and clear. Great purchase, this is my 3rd Kodak camera and this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ONE  CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: IT IS A GOOD CAMERA .IT TAKES GOOD PICTURES. I HAVE NO PROBLINGS WITH IT THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: E. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: works great not worried about lending it to some of my dumb relatives hope it lasts me many years thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth a. Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love Kodak Easy Share Cameras. This is my 5th one. I gave two of them to my children who also love them. I love getting the newest models. I have not found a point and shoot that I like better and I have tried several other brand name cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A.

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures and easy to use. Sound on camera barely audible.
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera overall, but sound is too low on video playback. Photos are sharp and has good telephoto lens. Much easier to use than the Kodak M580, which I returned because the buttons were too small and awkward to use. The size of the Z950 is easy to put in purse, but the buttons are still large enough to manipulate.
customer_reviews.author: joyceomaha

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, disappointing video
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known that the videos created are in QuickTime or MP3 format. Not easily compatible with Windows Movie Maker. The videos also are quite grainy in low light. But still pictures are quite good and this is an amazingly easy camera to use, which makes this a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: gimme a thinking nurse anyday

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Money
customer_reviews.text: This camera died after few days of used. The features are great but the overall product build and quality are very poor. PROS: 10x Zoom Image Quality User Friendly Easy To Operate CONS: Controls Poor Build Quality Cheap A lot of Noises
customer_reviews.author: Sol David Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Takes GREAT outdoor daylight pictures inside pictures not so much
customer_reviews.text: Like I said great outdoor pictures in the daylight not so much at night they all come out really dark. & inside most come our too dark when the flash doesn't flash, & when it does the picture is all white from the flash and every couple pictures comes out fine sometimes, it's really frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Miss it
customer_reviews.text: The lens was fantastic and super sharp. Unfortunately, the card reader was defective, so I returned the camera. I truly miss the lens though. I have a few photos which remind me of its quality.
customer_reviews.author: VSL

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: The Kodak Z950 is a very nice camera. Easy to use, takes great pictures! Nice zoom! I love good pictures but didn't want a complicated camera to work with. This is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a Christmas present for my mother. She is very impressed with the quality of the pictures. She stood on the front porch of her house and took a picture a house down the street and was able to zoom in and actually read the license plate number.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: I received the camera but have not used it enough to give a fair review. I do wish that it had a better and more detailed how to use booklet. It does have built-in help instructions but I am more comfortable with hands on info. I do like the feel and construction. I am not a regular camera user except for when traveling, attending family functions and etc, but I do like to keep a good one in my possession.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ison

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: didn't last very long maybe a year, then the zoom quit working, thus the camera quit. Worthless piece of ####
customer_reviews.author: Allen Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Kodak EasyShare Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was bought as a present. It has been a joy to the family who received it! It was new and came with everything that was stated. You need to buy a larger memory card but that is all.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith M. Bittner

customer_reviews.title: Solid Camera, Lots of Features, Competitive Price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I like the smaller size and the long zoom. Great price on Amazon. Looking forward to taking a lot of pictures with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Kodak EasyShare Z950
customer_reviews.text: I bought it, took pictures, and they look great. Easy to use, a great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Roger W. Whitehead Sr.

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: great camera! I have another Kodak camera and have always loved them. It takes great pictures and is very easy to use. It could turn on a little faster but that is the only downsize.
customer_reviews.author: L. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: I used this for years until I dropped mine and lost screen
customer_reviews.text: This camera was compact and carried accessories on my belt. I got the best pictures and easy to carry especially now with only my right hand working after accident with left arm. I have extra batteries always with me.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Bruens

customer_reviews.title: kodak
customer_reviews.text: first kodak and i am very pleased with it. I wish there was like a lip around the screen though to protect it if you set it down for a second and didnt want it to get sratched.
customer_reviews.author: Vince D. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great pictures, even in dark places
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, good zoom, great pictures even in dark areas, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: H. Pulliam

customer_reviews.title: Camera sent when requested
customer_reviews.text: I had requested to get the camera earlier than what was submitted and I did get it early as requested. It's a fine camera.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Crooks

customer_reviews.title: Kodak EasyShare Z950 Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Z950 and I love it, the pictures always come out great and it is easy to learn and use.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie West

customer_reviews.title: Z950 review
customer_reviews.text: The Kodak EAshShare Z950 camera is replacing my DX7630 camera which was damaged during my last sight seeing tour. The Z950 is more compact, better features and a most satisfactory replacement!!
customer_reviews.author: Don A. Ross, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great (for 2 days)
customer_reviews.text: I had the camera for two days then it stopped working. The seller was very good and refunded my money quickly. I have had a panasonic camera for over two years and a nikon for over four that both stilll work fine. This may have been a fluke but I will stick to panasonic and nikons in the future
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What the Heck?!
customer_reviews.text: The Kodak Z950 that I received in the mail looked used and old from the look of the original kodak box case. The product looked like it was used before with creases on the plastic bags (New Products should not have regular scotch tape on the original box case) that had the camera in it. I also found this problem with the other bags that contained the charger that comes with the camera and the bag for the USB charging chords. This product was not what I expected. Overall experience with this camera sucked. Do not by this product!!
customer_reviews.author: MR.V

customer_reviews.title: cheap?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera and had it for a week. I set it on the arm of my couch, which it fell off of. It landed on thick carpet. The camera never funcitoned again. Very fragile. Look for something tougher.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Clymer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes wonderful pictures, the only thing I have problem with is the focus when taking video, maybe it's me but it does not stabilize or the focus is not fixed. I love it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Snap Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Camera is all I expected, But have not mastered transfering to my pictures on my computer yet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: the camera I bought does not work. I need to know where I can sent it back for a replacement or money back Please answer this E Mail, Candace
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Not so good Video quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the supposedly HD 720P video resolution that it was suppose to have. I had just bought a 47" LCD TV and was anxious to try it out on it. It was a big let down for the price that I paid for it. The video was grainy. It was not even good to call it standard 480P resolution. This was really a big let down as this was the main reason that I purchased this model. The YouTube video advertisements look good and had a influence in my decision to go this model from Kodak. Now I will probably never buy a product from Kodak again because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Dannoone

product_meta.title: Kodak EasyShare Z950 12 MP Digital Camera (Black) with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD
product_meta.description:
Kodak EasyShare Z950 Digital Camera

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
You’ve been wishing your camera could take better pictures. And not just the kind where two people put their heads together and smile. Good news. The KODAK EASYSHARE Z950 Digital Camera gives you pro-like performance that’s easy to use. Get outstanding shots in challenging and creative scenarios using Kodak’s innovative Smart Capture feature, which automatically adjusts focus, flash, and exposure. And the 10X optical zoom lens with image stabilization helps you bring your pictures closer to perfection. 



Get clear quality fast, even from far away 

You’ve been wishing your camera could take better pictures. Good news. The Z950 gives you pro-like performance that’s easy to use, so you can get outstanding shots in challenging and creative scenarios. 10X optical zoom with image stabilization  * The 10X SCHNEIDER-KREUZNACH VARIOGON Optical Zoom Lens (35–350 mm) zooms in fast to deliver extraordinary creative performance
 * Fast f/3.5–f/4.8

Optical image stabilization  * Capture sharp, steady shots when shooting at long zoom ranges
 * Camera shake is minimized to automatically deliver clear, sharp pictures

Amazing quality prints with 12 MP  * 12 MP means you can make stunning prints up to 30 × 40 in.
 * More megapixels means you can crop and enlarge and still have great picture quality
 * However you choose to print—at home, at retail, or online—trust Kodak for picture quality that’s truly exceptional and for memories that will last

Fast click-to-capture speed 

< 0.3 second click-to-capture speed means you can capture that challenging action shot without delay 

Show off your pictures  * Get a good look at your pictures on the big, bright 3 in. color LCD
 * Whether you shoot your pictures vertically or horizontally, view them right side up with auto picture rotation
 * In review mode, quickly magnify with pan, fast scroll through pictures, or view multi-up

Beautiful pictures, more often—automatically 

Become a better photographer with a smarter camera. Kodak’s innovative Smart Capture feature brings you easy-to-use pro-like performance, automatically. 

Kodak's Smart Capture feature 

Smart Capture automatically identifies the scene and adjusts camera settings for great pictures in almost any environment.  * Intelligent scene detection—detects and analyzes scene conditions
 * Intelligent capture control—automatically sets camera settings including exposure, focus and ISO for clear, sharp pictures even in low light and challenging situations
 * Intelligent image processing—reduces noise and clears up dark shadows for vibrant, crisp details and true-to-life colors
 * Experience Smart Capture

True HD quality: capture stunning pictures and video 

HD picture capture  * Take stunning HD pictures in 16:9 format
 * View your pictures in high definition on an HDTV or other HD devices[1]

HD video capture  * Capture HD quality video at 30 fps with sound and on-camera editing
 * Capture more video while using less memory with MPEG-4 compression
 * Print multiple frames on a 4 × 6 in. print—4, 9, or 16-up
 * Save single frames and e-mail family and friends
 * Mark special spots in your video with video bookmarking

KODAK Theatre HD Player (optional device) 

For too long we have been turning on the television and simply watching what they send us. But now, the KODAK Theatre HD Player is changing how we see HDTV—by changing what we can see on it.  * Enjoy your new pictures and videos on your HDTV instantly, right from your camera’s memory card
 * Access pictures from your PC, camera, and online photo sharing sites, wirelessly
 * Wirelessly send and receive pictures with Kodak’s Picture Mail feature
 * Create slideshows to your favorite songs
 * Experience YouTube™ like never before—videos are brilliantly displayed on your HDTV
 * Access Internet radio, podcasts and other web content on your HDTV

The power to get the all the shots you want 

Li-Ion rechargeable battery  * Get energy that lasts with the power of the included Li-Ion rechargeable battery and in-camera charging
 * Smaller, lighter battery with higher voltage and energy capacity

Get creative with advanced camera features—PASM, scene, and color modes 

Program auto, aperture priority, shutter priority, and manual modes  * Program mode (P)—camera sets optimal shutter speed and aperture combination
 * Aperture priority mode (A)—you choose aperture, the camera sets shutter speed
 * Shutter priority mode (S)—you choose shutter speed, the camera sets aperture
 * Manual mode (M)—you choose both the aperture and shutter speed

Manual controls  * Exposure compensation—± 2.0 EV in ± 1/3 EV step increments
 * Aperture— f/3.5 (wide)–f/4.8 (tele)
 * Shutter speed—1/8–1/1250 sec. (auto), 16–1/1000 sec. (S/M mode)
 * ISO equivalents—(automatic) 100, 200, 400, 800, 1600, 3200[2]
 * Auto focus—TTL imager AF system
 * Exposure metering—multi-pattern, center-weighted, center-spot
 * White balance—auto, daylight, tungsten, fluorescent, open shade
 * Flash mode—auto, off, fill, red-eye reduction

Multiple scene modes  * Portrait modes—portrait, night portrait, backlight, self
 * Landscape modes—landscape, night landscape, fireworks
 * Bright scene modes—sport, beach, snow
 * Action modes—sport, children
 * Text/Documents mode—ensures sharp text when photographing documents
 * Manner/Museum mode—use when sound or flash are not desired

5 color modes  * High color
 * Low color
 * Natural color
 * Black and white
 * Sepia





Bring your pictures closer to perfection 

Great technology like face detection and high ISO mode let you shoot like a pro. But with on-camera features like multimedia slideshow, text and sound tags, and HD video, taking the shot is just the beginning. Face detection 

Catch those great smiles—face detection locates faces and automatically adjusts camera settings for great shots of friends and family 

High ISO mode  * See the details in low-light conditions and fast-action situations with high ISO (up to 3200[3])
 * Faster shutter speeds mean you can capture scenes in low light and fast action
 * The camera automatically selects from ISO 100 to ISO 1600 based on lighting conditions
 * ISO 3200 available at 3.1 MP and less in PASM modes

Multimedia slideshow  * Tell your story your way—turn pictures into a creative multimedia slideshow right on your camera
 * Set the mood with pre-loaded sound themes
 * Insert creative transitions that bring your pictures to life

On-camera picture-enhancing features  * Create your perfect shot with features like cropping and auto picture rotation
 * Panorama stitch mode combines up to three shots into one large picture on-camera
 * Verify the exposure of your picture using the histogram feature on live view, quick view, and review

Text and sound tags  * Tag your pictures, on-camera, so you can easily find and organize them later using KODAK EASYSHARE Software
 * Let your pictures have their say with sound tags, or attach important details with text tags

KODAK PERFECT TOUCH Technology in PASM modes  * Make your pictures as vivid as the moment you took them
 * Relive your memories in richer detail
 * Clear up dark shadows and reveal better, brighter pictures

Internal memory plus  * Don’t miss a shot if your memory card becomes full—switch to in-camera memory quickly, thanks to the internal memory plus feature
 * 32 MB internal memory[4]and SD/SDHC card compatibility lets you start shooting right out of the box

The simple way to share 

The Z950 is part of the KODAK EASYSHARE System, so sharing your pictures is amazingly simple. Just press Share. One button upload via Share button  * Sharing starts right on the back of the camera
 * Upload and share your favorite pictures and videos to YouTube™ and KODAK Gallery via the Share button and KODAK EASYSHARE Software

KODAK EASYSHARE Software (included) 

The simplest way to organize, edit, create, and share.  * Organize your pictures with your own tags and star ratings then use the search feature to quickly find any picture in your collection
 * Edit your pictures with ease—select from a variety of simple tools that reduce red-eye, improve lighting, remove wrinkles and blemishes, and add text
 * Create personalized photo projects online or at home—choose from hundreds of templates and designs to create photobooks, cards, invitations, and much more
 * Share your pictures and videos with family and friends at the KODAK Gallery or YouTube™

Ready to go—right out of the box  * KODAK EASYSHARE Z950 Digital Camera
 * KODAK Li-Ion Rechargeable Digital Camera Battery KLIC-7003
 * USB AC adapter charging solution
 * USB cable
 * Wrist strap
 * User Guide with KODAK EASYSHARE Software
